resources.string: How do you quit apps?\nPressing Back always means that you have finished your work and want to quit.\nPressing Home will start the launcher and kick this app into background.

We love this design of Android, but some apps do not. They keep them in background and drain your battery, some even push useless notifications to draw your attention.

And Brevent is going to protect your phone from these apps.
Swipe away from Recent Screen or press Back and they will be force-stopped.
Press Home and they will be kept in the background to complete their tasks. Once the time period you set is out, they will be force-stopped.
What do you need to do? \nJust a simple command with your PC.

For ease of use, Brevent has an experimental ROOT mode, allowing you to skip using PC, and will auto start Brevent server on boot. ROOT mode compared with the normal mode no more features or better work results, for some devices ROOT mode can not even start Brevent server.

Brevent does not need ROOT or modify system files, so there is no residue after uninstallation. Brevent does not destroy the integrity of other applications, nor does it deal with applications that are not in the Brevent list.

Brevent uses plenty of Android\'s hidden APIs. Some third-party ROMs may modify these APIs, so there would be some issues when using. Therefore, it is not recommended to use Brevent directly on office equipment.
Enjoy Brevent, and if you find any issues, please read the store\'s details and submit feedback with logs.

The default Brevent method is \"App Standby\"(since Android 6.0). When an app is standby, it can\'t connect to the Internet or carry on it\'s tasks. You can change the Brevent method in the settings.\n\nTo decrease the system\'s battery consumption, Brevent will not force-stop apps which have no service processes, nor will it auto-brevent new-installed apps without service components. And to increase battery performance, Brevent server deals with apps centrally and delays the processes by 3 to 60 seconds according to the event level.

ADB (Android Debug Bridge) is a command-line tool that lets a PC communicate with an Android device. It\'s part of platform-tools, you can download it from here: https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/platform-tools.html (Long press, then select and copy).

1. Uncompress platform-tools-latest-<platform>.zip

2. Navigate to platform-tools directory

3. (for Windows) Hold Shift key, then right-click, choose "Open command window here", please use ".\adb" to replace the hinted "adb" (please remove duplicate "adb" when paste the command line)

3. (for Mac OS X) Navigate "Finder", "Applications", "Utilities", open "Terminal", then drag "adb" into the "Terminal", please use "adb" with full path to replace the hinted "adb" (please remove duplicate "adb" when paste the command line)

4. You need to ADB every time after you turn on your device, please avoid restarting or shutting down your device as much as possible.

1. Turn on "Developer options", enable "USB debugging" %1$s

2. Connect to PC via USB %2$s

3. Execute in PC's command line "adb devices", make sure PC can recognize device (Reader "Guide - ADB")

4. Execute in PC's command line "%3$s"
Brevent server started successfully. Please tap app icons to choose then brevent them
Retrieving processes status, just a moment. . .
Waiting events, please expand then collapse notification to make events. . .
Starting Brevent server, just a moment. . .
Checking Brevent server, just a moment. . .
Feel free to feedback.\n\nIf you have a GitHub account, please create an issue; you can view opened issues too.%s
Update Brevent list when apps installed or uninstalled

Standby when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out; force-stop when reach standby time out or clear them from Recent Tasks list\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Standby when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Force-Stop when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out, or clear apps from Recent Task list\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps which have no activity
Background apps will be brevented after %s\n\nBrevent shows inactive time for background apps dynamically
Force-stop when apps have standby for %1$s
Brevent immediately, auto-brevent non-service apps, force-stop safe apps.\n\nBe careful
All apps have the same signature with framework\n\nBe careful when breventing framework apps
Including system and framework apps which cannot be launched\n\nBe careful when breventing system and framework apps which cannot be launched
Checking Brevent server every 15 minutes, gather logs if necessary\n\nTurn on if Brevent stops unreasonably, and make Brevent battery not optimized
When checked, apps which have connected VPN won\'t be standby nor force-stopped\n\nRequires pay total 2 USD for Play version
When checked, apps which have connected VPN won\'t be standby nor force-stopped
Some apps move background instead of exiting when pressing Back\n\nRequires pay total 2 USD for Play version
Some apps move background instead of exiting when pressing Back

Tap here to feedback, and give a detail description

Please pay total 3 USD to use "Allow run as ROOT".

If you have paid, please disable Xposed, launch Alipay, tap Records, it should be recognized automatically.

If it cannot be recognized, or paid via non Alipay, please send Email with screenshots of payment details.

If payment verified, non-Play version can get upgrade in Play Store.

If you have paid, please disable Xposed, launch Alipay, tap Records, it should be recognized automatically.

If it cannot be recognized, or paid via non Alipay, please send Email with screenshots of payment details.
